cons: Working in a franchise is horrible . There is little to no career progression, commisions can be almost unachievable and you are not valued as an employee

title: ‘Retail sector: worst department as you're dealing with accounts’
pros:
- Work colleagues are great
- Full Time/Part Time perks on the bill is great. My bill was 0.00 every month
cons:
- KPIs are unrealistic
- Commission is horrible, even if you exceed your KPIs, not even worth the extra hard work for the money
- NO career progression from retail to head office
- ALOT of irate customers, store has no power to help
- Managers micro-manage in the retail sector, Area manage is worst

title: ‘A good place to work most of the time’
pros: The pay was great and parking avaliable onsite. The job did have its perks, including employee benefits relating to Optus products and services plus bonuses if Kpis met. The people that you work with make it enjoyable.
cons: Lack of support from management.  A lot of feedback is often fallen on deaf ears.

title: ‘Very good life-work balance working for one of the leading Australian companies in the field.’
pros:
Flexible working hours, including telecommuting.
Very good employee benefits
Excellent campus (Sydney) with child care, gym, mini-markets, live music and a large variety of cuisines.
Shuttle bus to train stations.
cons:
Career advancement can be difficult.
A big part of the departments are outsourced.

title: ‘Working at Optus was exciting, productive, challenging and rewarding for most of my 23 years as an employee at Optus.’
pros: Always challenging and productive, room and scope for innovation, management encouraged individual as well as team effort, was a very can-do institution with a strong commitment to outcomes and not bogged down in process.
cons: The main Challenges were to insure the things that made Optus a good employer remained in place as these were the qualities that made our customers happy with Optus from day one.

title: ‘Optus has SO much potential and the people are great but the sales support including pricing systems need replacing. Possibly good to start at Optus now and hopefully ride the wave.’
pros: There are a wide variety of roles to apply for at Optus - if you can gain your managers' approval to move out of where you are (even if a manager in the new area wants you to join his / her team).
cons: So many divisions to gain support from and it's like herding cats. There are some great people and managers though to be fair. Just not in my area of the business. Remuneration varies and was ok for me but sales targets impossible to achieve (so little chance of overachievement bonuses).

title: ‘Great for short career stints but be prepared to be thrown into the deep end’

cons: Completely chaotic work atmosphere. Started as a disrupter in the Telecommunication industry and still haven't transformed into a large corporate with systems and proper processes

title: ‘A good place to work most of the time’

title: ‘Working at Optus was exciting, productive, challenging and rewarding for most of my 23 years as an employee at Optus.’
pros: Always challenging and productive, room and scope for innovation, management encouraged individual as well as team effort, was a very can-do institution with a strong commitment to outcomes and not bogged down in process.
cons: The main Challenges were to insure the things that made Optus a good employer remained in place as these were the qualities that made our customers happy with Optus from day one.

title: ‘Optus has SO much potential and the people are great but the sales support including pricing systems need replacing. Possibly good to start at Optus now and hopefully ride the wave.’
pros: There are a wide variety of roles to apply for at Optus - if you can gain your managers' approval to move out of where you are (even if a manager in the new area wants you to join his / her team).
cons: So many divisions to gain support from and it's like herding cats. There are some great people and managers though to be fair. Just not in my area of the business. Remuneration varies and was ok for me but sales targets impossible to achieve (so little chance of overachievement bonuses).

title: ‘Great for short career stints but be prepared to be thrown into the deep end’
